cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 385 mi (615 km) SE of Wilmington, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across the southwest Atlantic, slowing as it approaches the North Carolina/South Carolina coastline, then expected to meander inland across the eastern Carolinas and weaken while drifting west–south-westward.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from north of the NC/VA border to Cape Charles Light, VA and Chesapeake Bay south of New Point Comfort
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning South Santee River SC to Duck NC, Tropical Storm Warning north of Duck NC to NC/VA border
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coastal South Carolina through North Carolina and southeastern Virginia
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤5%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts possible late weekend.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along upper Chesapeake Bay; any surge <3 ft.
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 3–6 inches with locally higher amounts, leading to flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Fresh-water river flooding and saturated ground that could hinder cargo handling and landside access.
